history.content: Other than parallelism concepts (loop unrolling, etc.) or how the cache behaves for array accesses, I don't think there's a lot you'd gain out of this class, given your intended career track. However, it is definitely a cool class as you finally get an idea of how a computer works "under the hood".

children.subject:
If you want to do a PhD in stats, take a look through https://forum.thegradcafe.com/forum/48-mathematics-and-statistics/

A general TL;DR of the content is probably consider taking Math 104/105/202A; it seems like a much better use of your time than 61C (which by the way is a great course for learning about some of the hardware details of computers). Usually mathematical analysis is looked favorably upon (and probably a requirement for top programs) when applying.

history.content: Hi, I'm a stat major rising senior. Currently, I'm pretty sure I'm interested in a Data Science career path and am going to apply for data science master or Ph.D. program. So, just wondering, is CS61C necessary for data science at all? Or, I should take more math classes to enhance my math maturity. Thanks!
history.subject: 61C for Data Science?
